title: A model of financial market liquidity based on intermediary capital
abstract:
We present a model of financial market liquidity provided by financially constrained intermediaries.\ud
We show that market liquidity increases with the level of intermediary capital.We also characterize conditions under which intermediaries play a stabilizing or destabilizing role in markets. Finally, we sketch a number of areas, including welfare and public policy, on which the model can shed light
publisher: Wiley-Blackwell on behalf of the European Economic Association
